column4: Hi guys. I got myself into a spot of PPA trouble with Pidgin. I'm trying to clean it up but apt is giving me an error that I don't know how to deal with. Can someone please look at this http://pastie.org/3292911 and give me a hint?
what files are in ls /etc/apt/sources.list.d/
morgan@lappy:~$ ls /etc/apt/sources.list.d/* | grep -i pidgin  finds nothing.
apt-get update
then do apt-get remove pidgin && apt-get install pidgin
apt-get remove pidgin && apt-get install pidgin
apt says pidgin is not installed so it can't remove it, then the install has the error in nthe pastie.
you have to add the user to the sound group
*audio
thanks. I'll look at the groups first thing
it could be a problem with alsa not forwarding to pulseaudio
You were bang on. Adding the pulse-access group to my user fixed it straightaway
